snippet: Alex Rodriguez contributed to baseball’s long history of trick plays by fooling a runner into holding up at third base on Monday night.
abstract: Artful deceptions may seem to have no place in baseball, but they stretch back to the game's beginnings; New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez contributes to the sport's long history of trick plays by fooling a runner into holding up at third base in Game 2 of American League division series against Baltimore Orioles.
lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez contributed to baseball’s long history of trick plays by fooling a runner into holding up at third base on Monday night.

headline.seo: Baseball’s Best Trick Plays Are Deceiving
headline.main: Often, the Best Plays Are About What Isn’t There
headline.print_headline: Often, the Best Plays Are About What Isn’t There
